title: Protected areas of Puerto Rico
text: The protected areas of Puerto Rico include an array of natural areas in the archipelago of <a href="Puerto%20Rico">Puerto Rico</a>, an unincorporated territory of the United States, managed by a number of agencies and entities belonging to both <a href="Federal%20government%20of%20the%20United%20States">federal</a> and <a href="Government%20of%20Puerto%20Rico">commonwealth</a> government bodies. Although Puerto Rico has no natural units in the <a href="National%20Park%20Service">National Park System</a>, the biodiversity of the island is recognized and protected through a <a href="National%20forest%20%28United%20States%29">national forest</a>, a <a href="National%20Wildlife%20Refuge">national wildlife refuge</a>, a <a href="National%20Wilderness%20Preservation%20System">national wilderness</a>, and numerous <a href="State%20park">state parks</a> (often called "national parks" in Puerto Rico), nature reserves, <a href="List%20of%20Puerto%20Rico%20state%20forests">state forests</a>, wildlife preserves and other designations on state, municipal and public-private administration levels.
